title: Is 17 a good age to audition for a Kpop company? - Quora

response.answer_text: companies usually look for young people to become trainees, esp if their skills are lacking. it doesn't really matter what age you audition, as long as you're not too old. preferrably younger than 24. if you know your skills are lacking, then you might wanna start a bit earlier. if that's not an option, then you'd have to train for a long time, and you'd probably only debut once you're 20. in some cases, you have all the skills that company is looking for, but they don't have the right trainees to debut with you. it could take years to find members for a new group, and sometimes members might leave during the process. without these factors in mind, yes, 17 is a good age to audition. you'd be mature enough to make decisions and live on your own (if you're from abroad or if the company is far away from your home) but you're still very fresh and energetic.

I guess it depends. TBH it’s easier to train a trainee kids, that’s why some large company have their trainee mostly around age 11–15 and don’t be surprised when they debuted really young but already very talented. It’s risky though talentwise because… well, they will grow and their voice will break? Not only boys though, I also see girls grow up and have their voice change. But I guess it’s truly easier to shape kid rather than teenager (15–17) because of… puberty. But 17 isnt bad tho, you probably just need to do extra work since, yeah, mostly people ripe at 17 years old. In male case, you could probably have shorter activity time (sorry for my english) because you need to enlist to military at some time, but, I’ve seen people auditioned at 20 so why not?
